PageTitle: peer filter-policy export (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group.
The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group. The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. By default, no filtering policy is configured for the routes to be advertised to a peer group.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.  The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Specifies the number of the basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: If you do not want all routes to be advertised to a peer group, you can run the peer filter-policy export command to configure an ACL-based filtering policy to filter the routes to be advertised to the peer group.
